newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - U.S. Bancorp rallies.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - U.S. Bancorp rallies.

text.p: U.S. Bancorp shares gained six points to 54-1/4 preceding Thursday's U.S. market open on trading driven by the company's agreement to be acquired by First Bank System Inc for about $59 per share in stock.
The $9 billion deal weighed slightly on First Bank's shares, which slipped 1/2 to 77-3/4 in early third-market activity, traders said.
Elsewhere, Philip Morris Cos Inc stock suffered early, dropping five points to 117, traders said.
Tobacco shares generally are expected to tumble Thursday on news U.S. state attorneys general are close to a settlement with Liggett, the tobacco unit of Brooke Group Ltd.
Brooke shares made no move before the open, traders said.
Further weighing on Philip Morris was a Salomon Bros downgrade this morning to hold from buy.
Technology stocks, downtrodden in recent sessions, looked firmer before the opening bell, according to traders.

Sun Microsystems added 3/8 to 27, Intel traded in-line with last night's 133-5/8 close, Oracle also traded unchanged at 39-3/8, Microsoft edged up 1/4 to 97, Dell Computer climbed 1-1/8 to 64, 3Com added 1/16 to 32-1/4 and Qualcomm increased to55-1/4 from 54-1/16.
